definition: as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until

sentences.english: They arrived early in order that they might get a good seat.
sentences.chinese: 他们赶早而来以便能有个好座位。

sentences.english: We were planning on just having a snack and catching the early train.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算吃份快餐然后去赶早班火车。

sentences.english: Early flight to Nanchang so no time to worry about jet lag.
sentences.chinese: 赶早班飞机来南昌，没时间担心时差了。

sentences.english: Is there any hope of catching the early flight?
sentences.chinese: 赶早班飞机还有希望吗？

sentences.english: I got up early this morning in order to catch the early train.
sentences.chinese: 为了赶早车，今天早晨我起床很早。

sentences.english: Eg. We left early so that we could catch the first train.
sentences.chinese: 为了赶早班火车，我们走得很早。

sentences.english: I intended to catch the early train, but I didn't get up in time.
sentences.chinese: 我本来打算赶早班的火车，但是我起晚了。

sentences.english: I came to the class early so that I could see the classmate beside me.
sentences.chinese: 我赶早来上课，以便早点看到我旁边的同学。

sentences.english: Since last week, many people have gone there to taste the pot earlier than the mass.
sentences.chinese: 而上周开始，羊锅村里已有不少赶早尝鲜的食客。

sentences.english: The hour was his (real) girlfriend's self-imposed curfew, since she had to get up early for school.
sentences.chinese: 这个时间是H的女朋友因为要赶早上课而自行的宵禁。

sentences.english: Hurry up and clear out a couple of rooms where they can rest.
sentences.chinese: 你们赶早打扫两间屋子叫他们歇歇儿去。

definition: as soon as possible/as early as one can
not enough time (to do sth)/too late (to do sth)
at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
first thing in the morning/at daybreak
